DynamicStrategies 0.0.9000
  • Reference

Extract Portfolio Statistics from a Dynamic Simulation

Source: R/extract_stats.R
extract_stats.Rd

Computes the mean, standard deviation, skewness, kurtosis, Value-at-Risk (VaR) and Conditional Value-at-Risk CVaR) of a strategy.

extract_stats(simulation, level = 0.01)

Arguments

simulation

An object of the DynamicStrategies class.
level

A number with the desired probability level. The default is level = 0.01.

Value

A tibble with 3 columns.

Examples

utility <- simulate_strategy(strategy = "max_utility")
cppi    <- simulate_strategy(strategy = "cppi")
extract_stats(utility)

#> # A tibble: 6 × 2
#>   stat           value
#>   <fct>          <dbl>
#> 1 PnL        10632.   
#> 2 Volatility  1511.   
#> 3 Skewness       0.469
#> 4 Kurtosis       3.40 
#> 5 VaR         2406.   
#> 6 CVaR        2794.   
extract_stats(cppi)

#> # A tibble: 6 × 2
#>   stat          value
#>   <fct>         <dbl>
#> 1 PnL        10671.  
#> 2 Volatility  2592.  
#> 3 Skewness       2.19
#> 4 Kurtosis       8.09
#> 5 VaR          818.  
#> 6 CVaR         821.
